snippet: From their small brokerage firm, two men have led the fight against the surge of computer-driven, high-frequency trading on Wall Street.
abstract: Stockbrokers Sal L Arnuk and Joseph C Saluzzi at small New Jersey brokerage firm Themis Trading are taking on the powerful force of high-frequency trading, which accounts for almost half of all daily stock market trading in the United States; they warn of the dangers that HFT firms pose, including market instability and increased costs for investors; proponents of HFT call them embittered relics.
lead_paragraph: From their small brokerage firm, two men have led the fight against the surge of computer-driven, high-frequency trading on Wall Street.

headline.seo: High-Frequency Trading of Stocks Is Two Critics’ Target
headline.main: Searching for a Speed Limit in High-Frequency Trading
headline.print_headline: In Search of a Market Speed Limit
